intro: Nebropsis glabra, commonly known as the smooth nebropsis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes a wide variety of orchids. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette. Nebropsis glabra is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
